entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.

Quick Start

Create a new post

More info: Writing

Run server

More info: Server

Generate static files

More info: Generating

Deploy to remote sites

More info: Deployment

entry.title: 一个因子之和的积分表达
entry.content:
定义： 我们用 σ(n)\sigma(n)σ(n) 表示自然数 nnn 的所有因子之和，即

σ(n)=∑m∣nm\sigma(n) = \sum_{m|n}{m}σ(n)=m∣n∑​m

  (1). 若一个自然数 nnn , 做素因数分解：n=p1a1⋅⋅⋅pkakn = p_{1}^{a_1}\cdot\cdot\cdot p_{k}^{a_k}n=p1a1​​⋅⋅⋅pkak​​, 则有

σ(n)=p1a1+1−1p1−1⋅⋅⋅pkak+1−1pk−1\sigma(n) = \dfrac{p_{1}^{a_1+1} - 1}{p_1 - 1} \cdot\cdot\cdot \dfrac{p_{k}^{a_k+1} - 1}{p_k - 1}σ(n)=p1​−1p1a1​+1​−1​⋅⋅⋅pk​−1pkak​+1​−1​

证明：

  注意到

∏i=1k∑j=0αipij=∑(j1,⋅⋅⋅,jk)∈∏i=1k([0,αi]⋂N)p1j1⋅⋅⋅pkjk\prod_{i=1}^{k} {\sum_{j=0}^{ { {\alpha } _ {i} } } {p_{i}^{j} } } =\sum\limits_{\left( { {j}_{1} },\cdot \cdot \cdot ,{ {j}_{k} } \right)\in \prod_{ i=1 }^{k} {\left( \left[ 0,{ {\alpha }_{i} } \right]\bigcap N \right)} } { p_{1}^{ { {j}_{1} } } \cdot \cdot \cdot p_{k}^{ { {j}_{k} } } }i=1∏k​j=0∑αi​​pij​=(j1​,⋅⋅⋅,jk​)∈∏i=1k​([0,αi​]⋂N)∑​p1j1​​⋅⋅⋅pkjk​​

  而

σ(n)=p1a1+1−1p1−1⋅⋅⋅pkak+1−1pk−1=LHS=PHS=σ(n)\sigma(n) = \frac{p_{1}^{a_1 + 1} - 1}{p_1 - 1} \cdot\cdot\cdot \frac{p_{k}^{a_k+1} - 1}{p_k - 1} = LHS = PHS = \sigma(n)σ(n)=p1​−1p1a1​+1​−1​⋅⋅⋅pk​−1pkak​+1​−1​=LHS=PHS=σ(n)

证毕

  (2). 下面给出 σ(n)\sigma(n)σ(n) 的一个积分表达

σ(n)=∑m=1n∫0mcos⁡2nπ[x+1]mdx\sigma(n) = \sum_{m=1}^{n}\int_{0}^{m}\cos{\dfrac{2n\pi[x+1]}{m}}dxσ(n)=m=1∑n​∫0m​cosm2nπ[x+1]​dx

证明:

  我们考虑求和号里面的式子

  注意到, 利用 Euler 公式, 有

∑k=1mcos⁡2knπm=Re(∑k=1me2nkπim)\sum_{k=1}^{m}\cos{\dfrac{2kn\pi}{m}} = Re\left(\sum_{k=1}^{m}e^{\dfrac{2nk\pi i}{m}}\right)k=1∑m​cosm2knπ​=Re⎝⎜⎜⎛​k=1∑m​em2nkπi​⎠⎟⎟⎞​

  又

∑k=1me2nkπim={e2nmπim−1e2nπim−1=0,m∤nm,m ∣ n\sum_{k=1}^{m}e^{\dfrac{2nk\pi i}{m}} =\left\{\begin{matrix}\dfrac{e^{\dfrac{2nm\pi i}{m}}-1}{e^{\dfrac{2n\pi i}{m}}-1} = 0,\quad m \nmid n\\m, \quad m\ |\ n\end{matrix}\right.k=1∑m​em2nkπi​=⎩⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎨⎪⎪⎪⎪⎪⎧​em2nπi​−1em2nmπi​−1​=0,m∤nm,m ∣ n​

  所以，我们得到

∑k=1mcos⁡2knπm=Re(∑k=1me2nkπim)={0,m∤nm,m ∣ n\sum_{k=1}^{m}\cos{\dfrac{2kn\pi}{m}} = Re\left(\sum_{k=1}^{m}e^{\dfrac{2nk\pi i}{m}}\right) =\left\{\begin{matrix}0,\quad m \nmid n\\m, \quad m\ |\ n\end{matrix}\right.k=1∑m​cosm2knπ​=Re⎝⎜⎜⎛​k=1∑m​em2nkπi​⎠⎟⎟⎞​={0,m∤nm,m ∣ n​

  回到原式

RHS=∑m=1n∑k=1mcos⁡2knπm=∑m∣nm=σ(n)=LHSRHS = \sum_{m=1}^{n}\sum_{k=1}^{m}\cos{\dfrac{2kn\pi}{m}} = \sum_{m|n}m = \sigma(n) = LHSRHS=m=1∑n​k=1∑m​cosm2knπ​=m∣n∑​m=σ(n)=LHS

证毕

entry.title: 测度的延拓 - Exterior Measure
entry.content:
首先我们给出一个总的思路：(或者说前提小结，也可以说是摘要)

  我们从集 XXX 的某些子集所成的环 R\mathscr{R}R, 以及环 R\mathscr{R}R 上的测度 μ\muμ 出发. 根据环 R\mathscr{R}R 做集类 H(R)\mathscr{H(R)}H(R), 它是一个 σ−\sigma-σ−环. 然后由测度 μ\muμ, 在 H(R)\mathscr{H(R)}H(R) 上作出由 μ\muμ 引出的外测度 μ∗\mu ^{*}μ∗, μ∗\mu^*μ∗ 是 μ\muμ 的“延拓”, 即对于 ∀E∈R\forall E \in \mathscr{R}∀E∈R, 有 μ∗(E)=μ(E)\mu^*(E)=\mu(E)μ∗(E)=μ(E). 外测度 μ∗\mu^*μ∗ 具有测度的一部分性质, 但不一定有可加性, 一般来说只有次可加性. 但是, 我们可以利用 CaratheodoryCaratheodoryCaratheodory 条件分出了一类集, 即 μ∗−\mu^*-μ∗− 可测集的全体 (R∗⊂H(R))\left(\mathscr{R}^* \subset \mathscr{H(R)} \right)(R∗⊂H(R)), 是一个 σ−\sigma-σ−环. 而且, R\mathscr{R}R 中的元素都是 μ∗−\mu^*-μ∗− 可测集. 如果把外测度限制在 R∗\mathscr{R}^*R∗ 上, 可列可加性成立, 因此 μ∗\mu^*μ∗ 是 R∗\mathscr{R}^*R∗ 上的测度, 而且是完全测度.

定义 1： 设 R\mathscr{R}R 是集 XXX 上的环, 我们定义这样的集：

H(R)={E:E⊂⋃i=1∞Ei,Ei∈R}\mathscr{H(R)} = \left\{ E: E \subset \bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty}E_i, E_i \in \mathscr{R} \right\}H(R)={E:E⊂i=1⋃∞​Ei​,Ei​∈R}

显然, H(R)⊃R\mathscr{H(R) \supset R}H(R)⊃R 是一个 σ−\sigma-σ−环. H(R)\mathscr{H(R)}H(R) 中的每一个元素都能被 R\mathscr{R}R 中的可列个元素的并覆盖.

定义 2： 设 μ∗\mu^*μ∗ 是定义在 H(R)\mathscr{H(R)}H(R) 上的集函数, μ∗:H(R)→R\mu^*: \mathscr{H(R) \to R}μ∗:H(R)→R :

μ∗(E)=inf⁡{∑i=1∞Ei:E⊂⋃i=1∞Ei,Ei∈R}\mu^*(E) = \inf \left\{ \sum_{i=1}^{\infty}E_i : E\subset \bigcup_{i=1}^{\infty}E_i, E_i \in \mathscr{R}\right\}μ∗(E)=inf{i=1∑∞​Ei​:E⊂i=1⋃∞​Ei​,Ei​∈R}

称 μ∗\mu^*μ∗ 为由测度 μ\muμ 诱导出的外测度.

定义 3： (Carathodory条件)(Carathodory\text{条件})(Carathodory条件) 设 E∈R∗E \in \mathscr{R^*}E∈R∗ 及 F∈H(R)F \in \mathscr{H(R)}F∈H(R), 若成立：

μ∗(F)=μ∗(F∩E)+μ∗(F−E)\mu^*(F) = \mu^*(F\cap E) + \mu^*(F-E)μ∗(F)=μ∗(F∩E)+μ∗(F−E)

则称, 集 EEE 满足 Carathodory条件Carathodory\text{条件}Carathodory条件.

定义 4： 设 μ\muμ 是环 R\mathscr{R}R 上的测度, E∈RE \in \mathscr{R}E∈R. 如果有 μ(E)=0\mu(E) = 0μ(E)=0 就称 EEE 是 μ−\mu-μ−零集, 简称零集(零测集). 如果 R\mathscr{R}R 中任何 μ−\mu-μ−零集的任何子集都必定属于环 R\mathscr{R}R, 那么称 μ\muμ 是一个完全测度.

定理 ： μ∗−\mu^*-μ∗− 可测集的全体 R∗\mathscr{R^*}R∗ 是一个 σ−\sigma-σ−环, 并且 μ∗\mu^*μ∗ 是 R∗\mathscr{R^*}R∗ 上的测度.

有一些很重要的证明技巧, 充分利用下确界的定义, 需要掌握
entry.summary:
首先我们给出一个总的思路：(或者说前提小结，也可以说是摘要)

  我们从集

entry.title: Measure on the Ring
entry.content:
Definition 1:

Let XXX is a fixed set(or a Basic Space), and denote E:={E:E⊂X}\mathcal{E} := \left\{ E:E\subset X \right\}E:={E:E⊂X}. Call E\mathcal{E}E is a set class on XXX.

Definition 2:

Let E\mathcal{E}E is a set class on XXX, and if its elements satisfy:

∀E1,E2∈E\forall E_1,E_2 \in \mathcal{E}∀E1​,E2​∈E, have E1∪E2∈EE_1 \cup E_2 \in \mathcal{E}E1​∪E2​∈E and E1−E2∈EE_1-E_2 \in \mathcal{E}E1​−E2​∈E, then we called E\mathcal{E}E is a Ring on XXX and denote: R\mathcal{R}R.

In particular, if we have X∈RX \in \mathcal{R}X∈R, we called R\mathcal{R}R is a σ−\sigma-σ−Ring on XXX.

Definition 3:

Let E\mathcal{E}E is a set class on XXX, and define the mapping from E\mathcal{E}E to XXX:

μ:E→R\mu : \mathcal{E}\to \mathbb{R}μ:E→R

then, called μ\muμ is set function on E\mathcal{E}E.

Definition 4:

Let R\mathcal{R}R is a Ring on XXX, and we define the set function μ:R→R\mu : \mathcal{R}\to \mathbb{R}μ:R→R, and satisfied:

i>. μ(∅)=0\mu (\varnothing) = 0μ(∅)=0

ii>. (Non-negative) ∀E∈R\forall E \in \mathcal{R}∀E∈R, has μ(E)≥0\mu (E) \ge 0μ(E)≥0

iii>.(Additivity) En∈RE_n \in \mathcal{R}En​∈R, n=1,2,...n=1,2,...n=1,2,..., and ∀Ei∩Ej=∅(i≠j)\forall E_i \cap E_j=\varnothing (i \ne j)∀Ei​∩Ej​=∅(i​=j), have:

μ(⋃n=1∞En)=∑n=1∞μ(En)\mu \left(\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty}E_n \right) =\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\mu(E_n)μ(n=1⋃∞​En​)=n=1∑∞​μ(En​)

then, we called μ\muμ is a measure on R\mathcal{R}R.

Theorem

If R\mathcal{R}R is a Ring on XXX, and μ\muμ is a measure on R\mathcal{R}R, then it has:

  i>. (Limited additivity) If E1,E2,...,En∈RE_1,E_2,...,E_n \in \mathcal{R}E1​,E2​,...,En​∈R, and ∀Ei∩Ej=∅(i≠j)\forall E_i \cap E_j=\varnothing (i \ne j)∀Ei​∩Ej​=∅(i​=j),have:

μ(⋃i=1nEn)=∑i=1nμ(En)\mu \left(\bigcup_{i=1}^{n}E_n \right) =\sum_{i=1}^{n}\mu(E_n)μ(i=1⋃n​En​)=i=1∑n​μ(En​)

  ii>. (Monotonicity) If E1,E2∈RE_1,E_2 \in \mathcal{R}E1​,E2​∈R, and E1⊂E2E_1\subset E_2E1​⊂E2​, then

μ(E1)≤μ(E2)\mu(E_1) \le \mu(E_2)μ(E1​)≤μ(E2​)

  iii>. (Reducibility) If E1,E2∈RE_1,E_2 \in \mathcal{R}E1​,E2​∈R, E1⊂E2E_1\subset E_2E1​⊂E2​, and μ(E1)≤∞\mu(E_1) \le \inftyμ(E1​)≤∞, then

μ(E2−E1)=μ(E2)−μ(E1)\mu(E_2-E_1)=\mu(E_2)-\mu(E_1)μ(E2​−E1​)=μ(E2​)−μ(E1​)

  iv>. (Secondary additivity) If En,E∈RE_n,E \in \mathcal{R}En​,E∈R, n=1,2,...n=1,2,...n=1,2,..., and E⊂⋃n=1∞EnE\subset \bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty}E_nE⊂⋃n=1∞​En​, then

μ(E)≤∑n=1∞μ(En)\mu(E) \le \sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\mu(E_n)μ(E)≤n=1∑∞​μ(En​)

  v>. If En∈RE_n \in \mathcal{R}En​∈R, , E1⊂E2⊂⋅⋅⋅,E_1\subset E_2\subset \cdot \cdot \cdot ,E1​⊂E2​⊂⋅⋅⋅, and ⋃n=1∞En∈R\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty}E_n \in \mathcal{R}⋃n=1∞​En​∈R, then

μ(⋃n=1∞En)=lim⁡n→∞μ(En)\mu \left(\bigcup_{n=1}^{\infty}E_n \right) =\lim_{n\to \infty}\mu(E_n)μ(n=1⋃∞​En​)=n→∞lim​μ(En​)

  vi>. If En∈RE_n \in \mathcal{R}En​∈R, , E1⊃E2⊃⋅⋅⋅,E_1\supset E_2\supset \cdot \cdot \cdot ,E1​⊃E2​⊃⋅⋅⋅, ⋂n=1∞En∈R\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty}E_n \in \mathcal{R}⋂n=1∞​En​∈R, and ∃En\exists E_n∃En​ such that μ(Em)<∞\mu(E_m) < \inftyμ(Em​)<∞, then

μ(⋂n=1∞En)=lim⁡n→∞μ(En)\mu \left(\bigcap_{n=1}^{\infty}E_n \right) =\lim_{n\to \infty}\mu(E_n)μ(n=1⋂∞​En​)=n→∞lim​μ(En​)

In addition, if R\mathcal{R}R is a σ-Ring\sigma \text{-Ring}σ-Ring, we have:

  vii>. If En∈RE_n \in \mathcal{R}En​∈R, , then

μ(lim⁡inf⁡nEn)≤lim⁡inf⁡nμ(En)\mu\left(\lim\inf_{n}E_n\right) \le \lim\inf_{n}\mu(E_n)μ(limninf​En​)≤limninf​μ(En​)

  viii>. If En∈RE_n \in \mathcal{R}En​∈R, , and ∃k∈N\exists k \in \mathbb{N}∃k∈N, such that ⋃n=k∞En<∞\bigcup_{n=k}^{\infty}E_n < \infty⋃n=k∞​En​<∞, then

μ(lim⁡sup⁡nEn)≥lim⁡sup⁡nμ(En)\mu\left(\lim\sup_{n}E_n\right) \ge \lim\sup_{n}\mu(E_n)μ(limnsup​En​)≥limnsup​μ(En​)

  ix>. If En∈RE_n \in \mathcal{R}En​∈R, , lim⁡En\lim E_nlimEn​ exists and ∃k∈N\exists k \in \mathbb{N}∃k∈N such that ⋃n=k∞En<∞\bigcup_{n=k}^{\infty}E_n < \infty⋃n=k∞​En​<∞, then

μ(lim⁡n→∞En)=lim⁡n→∞μ(En)\mu\left(\lim_{n\to \infty}E_n\right) = \lim_{n\to \infty}\mu(E_n)μ(n→∞lim​En​)=n→∞lim​μ(En​)

  x. If En∈RE_n \in \mathcal{R}En​∈R, , and ∃k∈N\exists k \in \mathbb{N}∃k∈N such that ∑n=k∞μ(En)<∞\sum_{n=k}^{\infty}\mu(E_n) < \infty∑n=k∞​μ(En​)<∞, then

μ(lim⁡sup⁡nEn)=0\mu\left(\lim\sup_{n}E_n\right) = 0μ(limnsup​En​)=0

entry.title: Two problems of Chapter 2
entry.content:
Fourier Analysis

Problem 1

  One can construct Riemann integrable functions on [0,1][0,1][0,1] that have a dense set of discontinuities as follows.

 (a) Let f(x)=0f(x)=0f(x)=0, when x<0x<0x<0, and f(x)=1f(x)=1f(x)=1 if x≥0x\geq0x≥0. Choose a countable dense sequence {rn}\{r_n\}{rn​} in [0,1][0,1][0,1]. Then, show that function

F(x)=∑n=1∞1n2f(x−rn)F(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \dfrac{1}{n^2} f(x-r_n)F(x)=n=1∑∞​n21​f(x−rn​)

is integrable and has discontinuities at all points of the sequence {rn}\{r_n\}{rn​}

Proof:

 Step one: Note that F(x)F(x)F(x) is monotonic and bounded for the definition of fff,and F(x)≤F(x) \leqF(x)≤ Euler’s series, so that it has countable discontinuities at most. Hence, F(x)F(x)F(x) is integrable on [0,1][0,1][0,1].

  Step two: We consider that F(rn)F(r_n)F(rn​). {rn}\{r_n\}{rn​} is dense in [0,1][0,1][0,1] means ∀ε>0,\forall \varepsilon >0,∀ε>0, , ∃n∈N\exists n \in \mathbb{N}∃n∈N such that ∣x−rn∣<ε|x-r_n|<\varepsilon∣x−rn​∣<ε. Or ∀x1,x2∈[0,1]\forall x_1,x_2 \in [0,1]∀x1​,x2​∈[0,1], ∃n∈N\exists n \in \mathbb{N}∃n∈N such that rnr_nrn​ is between x1x_1x1​ and x2x_2x2​. Fixed x2=rnx_2 = r_nx2​=rn​, n=1,2,3,...n=1,2,3,...n=1,2,3,... and consider that:

∣F(x)−F(rn)∣|F(x)-F(r_n)|∣F(x)−F(rn​)∣

∀δ>0\forall \delta > 0∀δ>0, when ∣x−rn∣<δ|x-r_n| < \delta∣x−rn​∣<δ, we can find rmr_mrm​ is between xxx and rnr_nrn​. Due to F(x)F(x)F(x) is monotonic, we have

Where Cn,mC_{n,m}Cn,m​ is a constant(If we fix mmm and nnn). That is F(x)F(x)F(x) is discontinuous at all points x=rnx=r_nx=rn​.

(#)(\#)(#)

  (b)Consider next

F(x)=∑n=1∞3−ng(x−rn)F(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 3^{-n}g(x-r_n)F(x)=n=1∑∞​3−ng(x−rn​)

where g(x)=sin⁡1xg(x)=\sin{\dfrac{1}{x}}g(x)=sinx1​ when x≠0x\neq0x​=0, and g(0)=0g(0)=0g(0)=0. Then FFF is integrable, discontinuous at each x=rnx=r_nx=rn​, and fails to be monotonic in any subinterval of [0,1][0,1][0,1].

Proof:

  Note that g(x)g(x)g(x) is bounded, and the geometric series ∑3−n\sum 3^{-n}∑3−n is convergence. So F(x)F(x)F(x) is bounded.

Next, we discuss the integrability of F(x)F(x)F(x). Denote

U=∑j=1N[sup⁡xj−1≤x≤xj{∑n=1∞3−ng(x−rn)}](xj−xj−1)\mathcal{U}=\sum_{j=1}^{N}{\left[\sup_{x_{j-1} \leq x \leq x_j}\left\{\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 3^{-n}g(x-r_n)\right\}\right](x_j-x_{j-1})}U=j=1∑N​[xj−1​≤x≤xj​sup​{n=1∑∞​3−ng(x−rn​)}](xj​−xj−1​)

L=∑j=1N[inf⁡xj−1≤x≤xj{∑n=1∞3−ng(x−rn)}](xj−xj−1)\mathcal{L}=\sum_{j=1}^{N}{\left[\inf_{x_{j-1} \leq x \leq x_j}\left\{\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 3^{-n}g(x-r_n)\right\}\right](x_j-x_{j-1})}L=j=1∑N​[xj−1​≤x≤xj​inf​{n=1∑∞​3−ng(x−rn​)}](xj​−xj−1​)

Then,

U−L=∑j=1Nωj(x)(xj−xj−1)\mathcal{U-L}=\sum_{j=1}^{N}{\omega_j(x)(x_j-x_{j-1})}U−L=j=1∑N​ωj​(x)(xj​−xj−1​)

Where

So, we prove that there is at most countable ωj(x)>0\omega_j(x) > 0ωj​(x)>0 as N→∞N\to \inftyN→∞.

 © The original example of Riemann is the function

F(x)=∑n=1∞(nx)n2F(x)=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} \dfrac{(nx)}{n^2}F(x)=n=1∑∞​n2(nx)​

where (x)=x(x)=x(x)=x for x∈(−12,12]x \in (-\dfrac{1}{2},\dfrac{1}{2}]x∈(−21​,21​], and (x)(x)(x) is continued to R\mathbb{R}R by periodicity, that is, (x+1)=(x)(x+1)=(x)(x+1)=(x). It can be shown that FFF is discontinuous whenever x=m2nx=\dfrac{m}{2n}x=2nm​, where m,n∈Zm,n\in \mathbb{Z}m,n∈Z with mmm odd and n≠0n \neq 0n​=0.

Proof:

Problem 2

  Let DND_NDN​ denote the Dirichlet kernel

DN(θ)=∑k=−NNeikθ=sin⁡(N+12θ)sin⁡θ2D_N(\theta)=\sum_{k=-N}^{N}e^{ik\theta}=\dfrac{\sin\left(N+\dfrac{1}{2} \theta\right)}{\sin\dfrac{\theta}{2}}DN​(θ)=k=−N∑N​eikθ=sin2θ​sin(N+21​θ)​

and define

LN=12π∫−ππ∣DN(θ)∣dθL_N=\dfrac{1}{2\pi}\int_{-\pi}^{\pi}\left|D_N(\theta)\right|d\thetaLN​=2π1​∫−ππ​∣DN​(θ)∣dθ

  (a)Prove that

LN≥clog⁡NL_N \geq c\log NLN​≥clogN

for some constant c>0c>0c>0.

  Proof:

  We calculate LNL_NLN​ straitly:

The last inequality is used Euler’s formula

∑k=1n1k=log⁡n+γn\sum_{k=1}^{n}{\dfrac{1}{k}}=\log n + \gamma_nk=1∑n​k1​=logn+γn​

Where γn\gamma_nγn​ is Euler constant.

  A more careful estimate gives

LN≥4π2log⁡N+O(1)L_N \ge \dfrac{4}{\pi^2} \log N +O(1)LN​≥π24​logN+O(1)

  (b)Prove the following as consequence: for each n≥1n\geq 1n≥1, there exists a continuous function fnf_nfn​ such that ∣fn∣<1\left|f_n \right|<1∣fn​∣<1 and ∣Sn(fn)(0)∣≥c′log⁡n\left| S_n(f_n)(0)\right| \geq c' \log n∣Sn​(fn​)(0)∣≥c′logn.
entry.summary:
Fourier Analysis

Problem 1

  One can construct Riemann integrable functions on

entry.title: 常微分方程解的存在唯一性定理
entry.content:
皮卡存在唯一性定理

1. 定义：

LipschitzLipschitzLipschitz 条件：

 设f(x)f(x)f(x)是定义在R{\mathbb{R}}R上的连续函数，若∀x1,x2∈R\forall x_1 , x_2 \in {\mathbb{R}}∀x1​,x2​∈R，都存在LLL,使得：

∣f(x1)−f(x2)∣≤L∣x1−x2∣|f(x_1)-f(x_2)| \leq L|x_1 - x_2|∣f(x1​)−f(x2​)∣≤L∣x1​−x2​∣

则称f(x)f(x)f(x)在R{\mathbb{R}}R上满足LipschitzLipschitzLipschitz条件

2. 定理内容

 设初值问题：

(E):dydx=f(x,y),y(x0)=y0(E):\quad\dfrac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{d} x}=f(x,y),\quad y(x_0)=y_0(E):dxdy​=f(x,y),y(x0​)=y0​

其中f(x,y)f(x,y)f(x,y)在矩形区域：

∣x−x0∣≤a,∣y−y0∣≤b|x-x_0| \leq a ,\quad |y-y_0| \leq b∣x−x0​∣≤a,∣y−y0​∣≤b

内连续，且对yyy满足LipschitzLipschitzLipschitz条件.则(E)(E)(E)在区间I=[x0−h,x0+h]I=[x_0-h,x_0+h]I=[x0​−h,x0​+h]上有且仅有一个解，其中常数

h=min{a,bM},而M>max⁡(x,y)∈R∣f(x,y)∣h=\mathrm{min}\{a,\dfrac{b}{M}\},而M>\max_{(x,y)\in \mathbb{R}}{|f(x,y)|}h=min{a,Mb​},而M>(x,y)∈Rmax​∣f(x,y)∣
